I liked the first one a lot but then I read the books and realised how watered down it was and now I'm probably gonna watch this begrudgingly  SO word of advice for anyone who has seen the first movie but hasn''t read the book and is planning to, just watch the whole movie series and then begin. For example, when house atreides lands on Arrakis, they throw a dinner party where they invite all the different people. THIS SCENE IS CRUCIAL. The dinner scene goes on for probably more than a hundred pages and the sheer excitement  it provides is incomparable to anything. You understand the dynamics of the political powers, how a crown prince is being trained is statecraft, the equation between paul and his mother. Everything is just so elaborate and lifelike. That entire sequence was gone from the first movie and they just skimmed over. And there are many like this. I wish this had been made over 5-10 seasons at a game of thrones level. But nonetheless, good introduction to people who've not read. So if you are planning to pick up the books, do so after finishing the movies.
